Successfully knitted.

# Setup

```{r setup}
library(pubmedDashboard)
library(dplyr)
API_TOKEN_PUBMED <- keyring::key_get("pubmed", "rempsyc")
```

# PlosOne

```{r plosone, eval=F}
# Dealing with PLOS journal (only starts in 2007)
# lapply(2011:2022, \(x) {
lapply(2011, \(x) {
  lapply(1:12, \(y) {
    save_process_pubmed_batch(
      journal = "Plos one",
      year_low = x,
      year_high = x,
      month_low = y,
      month_high = y,
      suffix = "plos",
      api_key = API_TOKEN_PUBMED)
    })
})

# Breaks after year 2011...
save_process_pubmed_batch(
      journal = "Plos one",
      year_low = 2011,
      year_high = 2011,
      month_low = "01",
      month_high = "01",
      day_low = "01",
      day_high = "01",
      suffix = "plos",
      api_key = API_TOKEN_PUBMED)
```

# PNAS

```{r pnas, eval=F}
# Dealing with PNAS journal
lapply(1980:2023, \(x) {
  save_process_pubmed_batch(
    journal = "Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America",
    year_low = x,
    year_high = x,
    suffix = "pnas",
    api_key = API_TOKEN_PUBMED)
})
```

# Psychology

```{r psychology, eval=T}
setwd("data/psychology")
# Dealing with all other journals
lapply(1980:2023, \(x) {
  save_process_pubmed_batch(
    journal = journal_field %>% 
      filter(field == "psychology") %>% 
      pull(journal),
    year_low = x,
    year_high = x,
    suffix = "psychology",
    api_key = API_TOKEN_PUBMED)
})
```

unlink("data/easyPubMed_data_01.txt")
